main event: A Lieutenant Colonel observed a round, bright-white object hovering and pulsing in the sky near Orangeville, Maryland for about 15 minutes on March 6, 1954.
interesting points: The observation was made at night using naked eye and binoculars., The object was described as baseball-sized with no visible tail or exhaust., The sighting was reported by a civilian, the Civil Defense Director of Baltimore., Conclusions included possibilities of it being a balloon, aircraft, or unidentified., There were no photographs available in the report.
witness description: Lieutenant Colonel, Civil Defense Director of Baltimore, Maryland
